title: Air India crash: Victims' kin sue Boeing, Honeywell; blame fuel cutoff switches
content: Families of Air India Flight AI171 crash victims are suing Boeing and Honeywell, alleging faulty fuel switches caused the disaster. The lawsuit claims the switches' design led to accidental activation, cutting engine power shortly after takeoff. Despite meeting regulatory requirements, the switches' placement is questioned, though experts deem accidental activation unlikely.

title: Online gaming regulation: New rules to take effect from October 1
content: New online gaming regulations are set to be implemented from October 1st, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The government has engaged in extensive discussions with stakeholders, including gaming companies and banks, to finalize the rules. The legislation aims to promote e-sports while banning harmful money-based gaming and associated financial activities, with penalties targeting providers and promoters rather than players.

title: ‘Beaten to death with baseball bat’: Inside the grisly murder of 71-year-old NRI
content: In a shocking incident near Ludhiana, NRI Rupinder Kaur was allegedly murdered by Sukhjit Singh, at the behest of Charanjit Singh, residing in UK. Rupinder was killed to prevent her from filing a case against Charanjit after he backed out of marriage. Sukhjit allegedly bludgeoned her, burnt the body, and disposed of the remains in a canal.

title: Who is Sachin Yadav? Indian javelin throw star who outshone Neeraj Chopra
content: Sachin Yadav, the Indian javelin thrower, made a significant impact at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, securing fourth place with a personal best of 86.27 metres. He surpassed expectations by outperforming prominent Asian competitors Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem.

title: Jimmy Kimmel under fire: Musk calls him ‘disgusting’; Row over Kirk comments
content: Jimmy Kimmel Live! has been suspended indefinitely by ABC following controversial comments made by Kimmel about Charlie Kirk and linking his alleged killer to President Trump's MAGA movement. Nexstar Media also announced it would cease airing the show. Donald Trump celebrated the suspension, calling it "great news for America."

title: Exclusive | Handshake row: PCB's emails to ICC, closed door meeting & Pycroft's non apology
content: Amidst uncertainty surrounding Pakistan's Asia Cup participation, the PCB demanded match referee Andy Pycroft's removal, alleging code of conduct violations during the India-Pakistan match, specifically regarding the captains not shaking hands. Despite PCB's threats, the ICC stood firm, asserting Pycroft followed ACC instructions and didn't violate any rules.

title: Mumbai’s Metro Line 3: Seamless underground transit for commuters
content: Mumbai's Metro Line 3 will inaugurate on September 30. Travel time between South Mumbai and T2 airport will reduce to 45 minutes. The Cuffe Parade-Aarey stretch will cost Rs 70 and take 54 minutes. This underground metro aims to ease road congestion. Kalbadevi and Girgaon stations are now ready after initial delays.

title: 20 years later: Intel gets $5B lifeline; from company it wouldn't buy
content: Two decades after Intel declined to acquire Nvidia for $20 billion, the tables have turned. Nvidia is now investing $5 billion in Intel, forging a chip partnership where Intel will embed Nvidia's graphics and manufacture AI processors. This deal highlights Nvidia's rise to AI dominance, while Intel seeks relevance through collaboration after missing the AI revolution.

title: Neeraj Chopra rips off belt; covers face after final elimination - watch
content: Neeraj Chopra finished eighth in the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships. His best throw was 84.03m. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold. Anderson Peters secured silver, and Curtis Thompson took bronze. Sachin Yadav of India finished fourth with a personal best. Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan ended in tenth place.

title: 'Stop giving excuses': Rahul on EC's fact-check; targets CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, alleging obstruction of the investigation into vote fraud in the Aland assembly constituency. Gandhi claims the CEC blocked the FIR and CID investigation, potentially impacting the 2023 election results. The Election Commission has refuted Gandhi's claims, dismissing the allegations of massive vote deletion as baseless and incorrect.

title: Lamine Yamal’s love life: Nicki Nicole moments go viral — fans react
content: Footballer Lamine Yamal and singer Nicki Nicole are now a couple. They shared their love story on social media. Fans are very happy to see them together. Nicki is learning Catalan from Lamine. They are spending time together in Barcelona and Monaco. Lamine is a rising star in football. Nicki is a global music icon from Argentina.

title: US citizenship process update: USCIS unveils new test; applicants face stricter rules
content: USCIS is set to implement a new naturalization civics test in 2025, aiming to assess immigrants' understanding of US history and government. This is part of an effort to reinforce the integrity of the naturalization process. Stricter rules, including tougher reviews and neighborhood investigations, are also being rolled out to ensure eligibility and good moral character.

title: US citizenship test hardens: Guideline for India H-1B holders; what to prepare
content: Indian H-1B visa holders aiming for US green cards now face tougher hurdles as the US reinstates a stricter citizenship test from October 2025. Applicants must answer 12 of 20 civics questions from a 128-question pool, alongside heightened background checks. For Indians, the second-largest immigrant group in America, preparation and awareness are key to navigating these evolving immigration rules.

title: World Athletics Championships: Neeraj Chopra finishes 8th in javelin throw final; Sachin Yadav 4th
content: Neeraj Chopra's quest for another World Athletics Championships medal fell short as he finished eighth in the men's javelin final, a stark contrast to his previous triumph at the same venue. Keshorn Walcott secured the gold, while Anderson Peters took silver, and Curtis Thompson claimed bronze. Sachin Yadav of India narrowly missed the podium, finishing fourth.

title: 'Another setback': Cong attacks PM over Pak-Saudi pact; flags nat'l security concerns
content: The Congress party has voiced strong criticism of Prime Minister Modi regarding the newly established defence pact between Pakistan and Saudi Arabia, citing it as a significant threat to India's security. The agreement, which formalizes long-standing security cooperation, pledges mutual support against external aggression.

title: Solar eclipse: Date, time, and where it will be visible in US, Canada, Australia
content: A partial solar eclipse will grace the skies on September 21, 2025, primarily visible from the Southern Hemisphere. Skywatchers in southern New Zealand and eastern Australia, including Sydney and Melbourne, will have prime viewing opportunities. Safety is paramount; certified eclipse glasses are essential for direct observation.

title: Iga Świątek Net Worth 2025: Titles, sponsors soar — fortune revealed
content: Iga Świątek, the Polish tennis star, boasts an estimated $30 million net worth in 2025, fueled by tournament wins and endorsements. Her career prize money exceeds $41 million, including a significant Wimbledon victory against Amanda Anisimova. Świątek's endorsement deals with brands like On Sportswear and Porsche contribute substantially to her earnings. Ranked World No.

title: Nvidia to invest $5 billion in Intel; firms to co-develop AI infrastructure and PCs
content: Nvidia is set to invest $5 billion in Intel, forging a partnership to develop AI infrastructure and PC products. Nvidia will purchase Intel stock, and Intel will design custom processors for Nvidia's data centers and integrate Nvidia tech into PC chips. This collaboration aims to boost Intel, which has faced financial struggles, while expanding Nvidia's reach in the AI market.

title: Strange! 'Nobody buys a ticket to see Virat Kohli ... ': Former World Cup winner says
content: Balvinder Singh Sandhu proposes that the BCCI should consider using specialist fielders in domestic cricket and the IPL to manage the workload of senior players like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Jasprit Bumrah. He argues that excessive fielding puts unnecessary strain on these key players, potentially shortening their careers. "Why kill the goose that lays the golden egg?” he wrote in his Mid-Day column.

title: Indian-origin man held by ICE: In custody since July; all about Paramjit Singh's case
content: Paramjit Singh, a green card holder, has been detained by ICE after returning from India due to a decades-old minor infraction. Despite having a brain tumor and heart problems, his health is deteriorating in custody.

title: Maruti Suzuki cuts car prices: Brezza, Swift, Alto get cheaper; GST 2.0 savings
content: Maruti Suzuki has announced significant price reductions across its vehicle lineup, effective September 22, 2025, passing on GST 2.0 benefits to customers. Price cuts, reaching up to Rs 1.29 lakh, impact models like S-Presso, Alto K10, Swift, and Brezza. This move aims to stimulate demand during the festive season and strengthen Maruti Suzuki's market position.

title: IND A vs AUS A: Shreyas Iyer’s Test comeback dreams take a hit — falls for single digits
content: Shreyas Iyer's struggles continued as he scored only eight runs in the unofficial Test against Australia A, further jeopardizing his chances for a Test comeback. Australia A posted a formidable 532/6 declared, highlighted by centuries from Sam Konstas and Josh Phillippe. India A's innings saw contributions from Abhimanyu Easwaran and Sai Sudharsan, but Iyer's performance remained a concern.

title: 'I respect all religions': CJI on 'ask your deity' remark; all about Khajuraho case
content: Following social media criticism for his “go ask your deity” comment, CJI BR Gavai affirmed his respect for all religions. This came after a bench led by him dismissed a plea seeking reconstruction of a Lord Vishnu idol at the Javari Temple in Khajuraho, deeming it a “publicity interest litigation”.

title: 'Mobiles, software used': Rahul explains how Aland saw massive voter deletions
content: Rahul Gandhi presented evidence of mass voter deletions in Karnataka's Aland constituency, alleging a coordinated, software-driven operation targeting Congress voters before the 2023 elections. He highlighted instances of fraudulent deletion applications, unusual timings, and the use of mobile numbers from outside Karnataka. Gandhi asserted that these deletions were strategically focused on Congress-stronghold booths, indicating a deliberate attempt to disenfranchise voters.

title: UFC legend BJ Penn detained: Issues heartbreaking statement after 5th arrest
content: MMA icon B.J. Penn, arrested for the fifth time this year in Hawaii for allegedly violating a restraining order, has broken his silence. The former UFC champion expressed feelings of isolation on social media, contrasting his past surrounded by an entourage with his current solitude. Penn stated he has 'got nobody around to help me,' explaining he chooses isolation to protect loved ones.

title: Deep Earth anomaly: GRACE satellites reveal mantle shifts; core linked to magnetism
content: A recent study reveals dynamic transformations in Earth's lower mantle, impacting both earthquakes and the magnetic field. GRACE satellites detected a gravitational anomaly in 2007, linked to a mineral phase change that increased mantle density. This deformation of the core boundary coincided with unusual magnetic field disturbances, suggesting a connection between deep mantle activity and Earth's surface phenomena.

title: Where is Puja Khedkar's family? Father, driver flee in taxi after road rage kidnapping
content: Navi Mumbai police are searching for Dilip Khedkar, father of a dismissed IAS officer, and his chauffeur, Praful Salunkhe, in connection with a road rage kidnapping case. Investigators believe the two men abandoned their SUV and fled in a taxi to avoid arrest.

title: 'Pressure is eating him': Travis Kelce struggles with fame; NFL season heats up
content: Travis Kelce is reportedly feeling the pressure of increased scrutiny since his relationship with Taylor Swift began. Sources suggest the constant attention is impacting his on-field performance, leading to visible frustration. Swift is said to be concerned about the toll it's taking on Kelce as he navigates this new level of fame while striving to regain his form.

title: Rajasthan: Mom kills child by throwing her into Ana Sagar Lake; arrested
content: In a shocking incident in Ajmer, a woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her 3-year-old daughter by throwing her into Ana Sagar Lake. Anjali Singh, who had left her husband in Varanasi to live with another man, initially misled the police. However, CCTV footage revealed inconsistencies in her statements, leading to her confession.

title: 'Low quality': PCB accused of corruption; ex-player launches attack
content: Former Atiq-uz-Zaman criticised the PCB for providing substandard jerseys during the Asia Cup 2025, contrasting them with the dry-fit kits of other teams. Despite Pakistan's Super Four qualification after defeating UAE, Captain Salman Ali Agha acknowledged batting concerns, particularly in the middle overs. Agha emphasised the need for improvement before their crucial match against India on September 21.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Yoga trainer Niranjana Murthy accused of assaulting minor
content: In Bengaluru, Niranjana Murthy, a yoga trainer, has been arrested. He is accused of sexually harassing a minor girl. The girl, who attended his yoga classes, filed a complaint. Murthy allegedly harassed her during a trip to Thailand in 2023. He also promised her medals and placements. The police registered a case under the POCSO Act.

title: Goa ka ‘haunted airport’: YouTuber Akshay Vashisth arrested for comments
content: Goa police arrested Akshay Vashisth in Delhi for posting a video titled ‘Goa ka haunted airport’ on his Facebook channel, ‘Real Talk Clips.’ The video contained false information about Manohar International Airport at Mopa, which was flagged by a police constable.

title: UP: Husband hacks 7-month pregnant wife to death
content: In Lucknow's Gudamba, Ankur Lodhi murdered his pregnant wife, Neelam. He used a baanka during a domestic dispute. The attack also injured his mother, Phoolmati, who tried to intervene. Locals apprehended Ankur and handed him to the police. The incident occurred after Ankur participated in a Vishwakarma Puja event. Police have arrested Ankur Lodhi.

title: Ike Barinholtz plays Elon Musk: Actor will not meet Tesla CEO; reason revealed
content: Ike Barinholtz will portray Elon Musk in the upcoming film 'Artificial,' dramatizing OpenAI's 2023 leadership crisis. Barinholtz, starring alongside Andrew Garfield as Sam Altman, is foregoing a personal meeting with Musk. Instead, he's relying on Musk's extensive public appearances to capture his essence.

title: 'Did Cong win in Aland by vote chori?' BJP says Rahul 'dropped H-bomb on self'
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's allegations of mass voter deletion in Karnataka's Aland constituency, BJP MP Anurag Thakur questioned if Congress won the Aland seat in 2023 through "vote chori." Thakur criticized Gandhi for undermining the Election Commission's integrity, echoing Amit Malviya's point that the Congress candidate benefited from the alleged irregularities.

title: Involved in an accident? Here’s how not to make it worse
content: Following recent road accidents in Delhi, a comprehensive guide advises drivers and bystanders on effective responses. Immediate actions include calling 112, prioritizing victim transport to nearby hospitals, and understanding relevant legal sections like 106 for death by negligence and 281 for rash driving.

title: Dehradun floods: Farmer clings to 50m pole for 5 hours above raging river
content: In a dramatic rescue, Desh Pal, stranded on an electricity pole for five hours amidst a raging river in Dehradun, was saved by an NDRF team. Head constable Manmohan Singh, known for his Silkyara tunnel rescue expertise, executed a daring monkey crawl to reach the exhausted Pal.

title: Fact check: Did Pycroft 'apologise' to Pakistan at Asia Cup?
content: Pakistan threatened to withdraw from the Asia Cup after a perceived slight during the India-Pakistan match, claiming that India captain Suryakumar Yadav refused to shake hands with Pakistani counterpart Salman Ali Agha. The Pakistan Cricket Board said match referee Andy Pycroft apologised for miscommunication. But did he? We fact check that claim.

title: 'Getting help from inside ECI': Rahul Gandhi escalates 'vote chori' war
content: Rahul Gandhi escalated his criticism of Election Commission's chief Gyanesh Kumar, accusing him of protecting those who are destroying Indian democracy and systematically targeting minority and Dalit voters for deletion. He alleged centralized vote deletion in Karnataka, citing thousands of impersonator applications targeting Congress voters. Gandhi previously accused the EC of colluding with the BJP to steal elections, highlighting alleged voter fraud in Karnataka's Mahadevapura constituency.

title: Bhramari Pranayama: Shilpa Shetty credits ancient breathing practice for fitness
content: At 50, Shilpa Shetty reveals her secret weapon against stress: Bhramari Pranayama, or bee breath. She credits this simple breathing technique for maintaining balance, improving mental clarity, and staying calm amidst a busy lifestyle. The practice involves deep breathing with a bee-like humming sound, effectively reducing anxiety and regulating blood pressure.

title: Which 0-2 teams still have a shot at the playoffs? Barnwell ranks all 10 by turnaround likelihood
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: McLaughlin-Levrone dazzles in historic 400m win
content: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone became the first woman in nearly 40 years to crack the 48-second barrier in the 400 meters Thursday, finishing in 47.78 in an historically fast race to claim gold at the World Athletics Championships.

title: Lynx, fueled by 'desperation,' rally to oust Valkyries
content: The top-seeded Lynx rallied from a 17-point third-quarter deficit to beat the Valkyries 75-74 and advance to the next round of the WNBA playoffs.

title: Dodgers considering Ohtani helping as reliever
content: Dave Roberts said the Dodgers have talked about Shohei Ohtani pitching out of the bullpen in the playoffs. As for playing in the outfield, as Ohtani said Tuesday he would be willing to do, Roberts said that won't happen.

title: Sources: Messi, Miami near multiyear extension
content: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami are nearing a final agreement on a new multiyear contract with the deal expected to be completed soon, sources told ESPN.

title: Commanders given final approval for D.C. return
content: The Commanders' return to Washington is finally official as the District of Columbia Council voted 11-2 in favor of the measure once more -- an expected outcome given its vote more than a month ago but one that faced some brief uncertainty Wednesday.

title: NCAA removes spring transfer window for football
content: The NCAA voted to eliminate the spring transfer portal window but did not sign off on establishing Jan. 2-11 as the lone window for FBS and FCS players.

title: Johnson: I'm not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Cards' Murray sorry for post with Vick jersey, dog
content: Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray took down an Instagram post that included a photo of him wearing a Michael Vick jersey while posing with one of his bulldogs, saying that he "in no way, shape or form" condones dogfighting.

title: ♥️ Cardi B, Stefon Diggs expecting child
content: The Patriots wide receiver and Grammy Award-winning rapper have been spotted in public with each other since February.

title: 'If a cap is the only answer, we're all in trouble': What fight over salary cap means for MLB's future
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: Wetzel: WNBA's gold rush leaves Connecticut fans in the dust
content: The WNBA is repaying Connecticut fans for their loyalty by trying to move the Sun out of state, ESPN's Dan Wetzel writes.

title: Key matchups, quarterbacks who aren't meeting their preseason hype and more
content: Ahead of Week 4, we take a look at big conference matchups, quarterbacks who have room to grow, plus quotes.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Top playoff contenders on the move ahead of October
content: Some teams have already clinched postseason berths, while others are making one last push with 11 days to go. Where do they all stand on our second-to-last list?

title: 'Until we win games ... it doesn't matter': Why Dolphins are fixing a broken team culture
content: In 2024, accountability and tardiness issues with star players were common. Miami is trying to fix it.

title: Millions, MVP and marriage: 'There's more in life' for Bills QB Josh Allen
content: After an offseason of significant highs,  the QB shares a different perspective on football and its place in his life.

title: From 6 losing seasons to sneaky contenders: How the Dream rebuilt their franchise
content: Deal-making for the right players. A new coach. And a culture shift. Here's how Atlanta turned things around.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 3
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Early observations: Is Smith-Njigba a WR1? What to do with Henderson and Loveland?
content: Takeaways on more than a dozen players, including whether you should be patient with a pair of rookies.

title: Reunion or revenge? Transfers facing their old teams a new part of the season
content: In the transfer era, playing former teams is commonplace. How each side approaches these games affects the game plan and the players.

title: 'Bragging rights for all eternity': An ode to the Iron Skillet rivalry
content: Looking back at the history of the SMU-TCU grudge match before its 104th, and potentially final, edition.

title: Why the champs and four other teams control the future of the NBA draft
content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: 'They're done building around him': Inside the tumultuous Kawhi Leonard era in Los Angeles
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: No run game in Kansas City? Poor O-lines in Houston, Minnesota? Real-or-not ratings for every team
content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size?

title: What we're hearing: Latest on Aaron Rodgers, Bengals' plans without Joe Burrow
content: Our insiders have intel on Rodgers' first two games in Pittsburgh, Cincinnati's post-Burrow scramble and more.

title: What happens to a college football roster when a coach is fired in September?
content: UCLA and Virginia Tech fired their coaches Sunday after Week 3 of the college football season. What's next?

title: Champions League talking points: Is this Arsenal's year? Which stars shone for their team?
content: Behold, the Chaaaaampiooooons! That sound you hear is our collective joy at the UCL's return. ESPN experts offer their thoughts on Matchday 1 so far.

title: Isak might be the new star, but Salah remains Liverpool's main man
content: Alexander Isak made his Liverpool debut, but it was Mo Salah that lifted the Reds over Atletico Madrid.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye shock move for Man Utd's Mainoo
content: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is a transfer target for crosstown rivals Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Can the Giants afford to sit Jaxson Dart for the whole year? Here are the benefits
content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: Way-Too-Early Grand Slam predictions for 2026
content: The majors are done for the year -- is it too early to forecast who will reign supreme in 2026? Never.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: The blue line all-breakout team: Byram, Drysdale lead the next generation on D
content: Prepare for your fantasy hockey draft with these defensemen in the right situation to have a break out season.

title: MSME Export Promotion Council study highlights MSME growth in Kerala, but points out gaps
content: Several MSMEs are facing crisis due to non-availability of timely and affordable credit and gaps in implementation of government schemes

title: Land for industrial hub: Kaderu farmers to get ₹20 lakh per acre as compensation
content: Families losing livelihood due to acquisition will be provided jobs, and priority given to locals in employment opportunities, Revenue Minister Satya Prasad tells Legislative Council

title: Temporary care facilities for children with intellectual disabilities to be set up
content: Facilities will be set up in three locations in the State. Families will be able to safely leave these children for short periods in these centres if they have to be away for some reason

title: Police under lens in Kerala following cases of custodial torture
content: Complaints of custodial torture and police brutality are pouring in following the surfacing of CCTV footage of the alleged torture of a political activist at a police station in Kunnamkulam in Thrissur two years ago. K.S. Sudhi looks into the issues of legal and human rights violations involved in the alleged instances of custodial torture

title: One year old operated upon for rare hereditary vision problem
content: A team of doctors at Vasan Eye Care Hospital in Hubballi has successfully performed the rare zonular cataract surgery

title: With GBA coming into force, BMTC plans expansion of city bus services to 40-km radius
content: The State government issued a draft notification on September 18, inviting public objections and feedback on the proposed expansion

title: Approximation exercise to be taken up to identify beneficiaries of Ayushman Bharat Vay Vandana scheme
content: We estimate that about 17 lakh additional families (with over 24 lakh senior citizens) will be included through this approximation. Based on past experience, only 7% to  8% of these families will actually seek treatment in a given year, says  Harsh Gupta, Principal Secretary (Health and Family Welfare)

title: UK Deputy High Commissioner to attend Educational Pavilion in Vijayawada
content: Scheduled to be held September 22 to November 16 as part of Vijayawada Utsav, the programme aims to guide students on the courses, career opportunities, and admission processes in India and abroad

title: Survey taken up to determine location of tourism infrastructure near Chola Gangam lake
content: The State government announced a special scheme to develop the lake at a cost of ₹20 crore — ₹12 crore for developing the lake and ₹7.5 crore to create tourism infrastructure

title: Karnataka High Court dismisses with ₹50,000 cost a plea opposing release of Jolly LLB 3
content: It is obvious that the depiction of the courtroom scene in the movie appears to be aiming to appeal to the audience’s sense of humour, but may not appeal to the sense of humour of the petitioner, observed the bench

title: Crop loan SOP for banks violates RBI guidelines, alleges tenant farmers’ body in A.P.
content: The provision that loans can only be sanctioned if a landowner has no pending dues has barred thousands of tenant ryots from accessing loans, they say

title: IHRD, RCC sign MoU for collaborative research in cancer diagnosis
content: Aim is to develop technology-driven health-care services by undertaking research that utilises modern technologies like artificial intelligence in the field of cancer diagnosis

title: Govt. revitalising primary healthcare in Andhra Pradesh, says Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav
content: A sum of ₹194 crore is being spent on development of 100 PHCs, he says, adding that 2,600 vacancies in PHCs have been filled, while recruitment is underway to fill 344 posts in UHCs

title: Innovative IT interventions essential to popularise AYUSH, says national workshop
content: Meet calls for  inter-State cooperation to bridge the digital gap for easy accessibility to Ayurveda and other indigenous treatment systems

title: Madras High Court dismisses writ appeals filed by Indian Maritime University against its first vice-chancellor
content: A Division Bench confirms a single judge’s order which had quashed his 2018 dismissal from the post of director of IMU’s Chennai campus besides setting aside a penalty of ₹22.65 lakh imposed on him

title: Tiruchi Corporation to transform 120 garbage hotspots into aeshtetic green spaces
content: To promote recycling and reuse, discarded items from waste have been creatively repurposed for beautification and ceramic toilet closets and broken pots have been turned into planters while tyres are used as reusable flower pots

title: SEBI Dismisses Hindenburg's Allegations Against Adani Group Companies
content: Markets regulator Securities Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has dismissed allegations of stock manipulation levelled by US Short Seller Hindenburg Research against Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani and the group's companies.

title: Gujarat Couple Claims Son Held Captive For Over 5 Months In Thailand
content: A couple from Vadodara has claimed their 28-year-old son has been held captive for five months in Thailand, prompting police to launch a probe into the matter, an official said.

title: 'Kids Getting Raped, You Serving Israel': Kash Patel Booed Over Epstein Files
content: Kash Patel defended the Trump administration's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files as he faced questioning by Democrats over the case. In a video that is now going viral, Patel can be seen heckled by activists over the Epstein case and Israel.

title: 'Mini India On Moon': Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's Blueprint For Indian Lunar Village
content: In a Bengaluru lab, a blueprint of a futuristic Indian lunar village is being built with the help of astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, months after he returned to Earth aboard the Axion-4 mission.

title: Fauj Only Place Where There Is No Nepotism: Defence Chief Anil Chauhan
content: Chief of Defence Staff Gen Anil Chauhan on Thursday asserted that 'fauj' is the only place where there is no nepotism, as he urged children to aspire to join the armed forces to serve the nation and explore places.

title: Russia Uses Nazi-Era Arms In Ukraine Amid Shrinking Stockpiles: Report
content: Russia has reportedly started using Nazi-era weapons in its four-year-long war on Ukraine, as its military stockpiles dwindle and the Kremlin scrambles to rearm its forces.

title: Hyderabad-Bound Air India Express Flight Makes Emergency Landing In Vizag
content: An Air India Express flight from Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad with 103 passengers made an emergency landing here on Thursday, following an engine problem after a suspected bird hit mid-air, said an official.

title: National Geographic Features Indian Photographer's Shot Of Rare Black Tiger
content: Indian photographer Prasenjeet Yadav's image of a black tiger from Odisha's Similipal National Park has featured on the cover of National Geographic magazine's upcoming October 2025 edition.

title: Private University Student From Tripura Alleges Rape In Assam, 2 Accused From Manipur Detained: Police
content: Two students of a private university in Assam have been detained after a girl student alleged she was raped, a senior police officer told reporters today.

title: Sex, Money, And Power: Scandal At The Heart Of China's Shaolin Temple
content: China has launched a crackdown on powerful Buddhist monks suspected of misusing temple funds for personal wealth.

title: Kangana Ranaut Meets Flood Victims, Then Tells Them Her Cafe Made Only Rs 50
content: Actor-turned-politician and BJP MP from Himachal Pradesh's Mandi, Kangana Ranaut, on Thursday expressed her distress over financial losses at her restaurant in Manali when she met residents affected by floods and landslides in Himachal Pradesh.

title: Row Over Bhopal BJP MP Alok Sharma's Warning For "Love Jihad At Garba Events"
content: A fresh political controversy erupted in Madhya Pradesh with the Navratri festival around the corner, after the BJP MP from Bhopal, Alok Sharma, issued a warning against the participation of non-Hindus in Garba events, calling them "love jihadis."

title: 'We Did More Good For Humanity Than Others': Donald Trump At UK State Dinner
content: US President Donald Trump was greeted with royal pomp on Wednesday as his second UK state visit began. King Charles III hosted Trump at Windsor Castle.

title: Man, Daughter Killed After Bike Collides With Truck In Maharashtra: Cops
content: A man and his three-year-old daughter were killed on Thursday after their motorcycle collided with a container truck in Bhiwandi in Thane district.

title: Secret Marriage, 1 Crore Loan: Missing Odisha Woman Cop Found Murdered
content: A 25-year-old traffic police constable from Odisha's Bhubaneswar, who went missing early this month, has been found dead. The police have recovered her body from a jungle in Keonjhar district.

title: British MP Bob Blackman Hosts PM Modi's Birthday At House Of Commons
content: British MP Bob Blackman brought together community leaders, spiritual figures and parliamentarians at the UK House of Commons to celebrate Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday.

title: UK NRI Promised Punjab Man Rs 50 Lakh, Life Abroad To Kill US Woman
content: The UK-based NRI who ordered the murder of a 71-year-old US citizen of Indian origin had said he would marry her after meeting her on a matrimonial site and had promised her killer Rs 50 lakh and a new life abroad, police have said.

title: Why Tejashwi Yadav Does Not Want Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM In Bihar Alliance
content: Last week, MLA and AIMIM's Bihar chief Akhtarul Iman arrived at RJD founder Lalu Prasad Yadav's residence at Patna's Circular Road with a posse of drumbeaters

title: Delhi Zoo's Lone African Elephant Dies At 29, Probe Ordered
content: Shankar, the only African elephant at the Delhi Zoo, has died and an investigation has been ordered to determine the cause of death, officials said on Thursday.

title: "I Respect All Religions": Chief Justice BR Gavai After Deity Remark Row
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Thursday said that his remarks in the matter concerning the restoration of a Lord Vishnu Idol in Khajuraho are being misportrayed on social media.

title: Nellore car accident: CM announces ex gratia of ₹5 lakh each for kin of deceased
content: CPM and YSRCP leaders demand ₹25 lakh each for the families of the people killed in the accident; ask SP to prevent illegal sand and gravel mining in the city

title: NDA govt. in Andhra Pradesh has cancelled house site pattas given to poor women, alleges Jagan
content: The government has diverted prime lands to private industrial parks, reflecting a pro-rich, anti-poor stance, the YSRCP president alleges, and vows to fight the move legally and politically

title: SEBI clears Adani Group, Gautam Adani of Hindenburg-linked allegations
content: In two separate orders, SEBI found no violations, noting that at the time such transactions with unrelated parties did not qualify as related party dealings (the definition was expanded only after a 2021 amendment).

title: Kerala Governor asks universities to bear legal costs in V-C appointment case
content: APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University and Digital University Kerala have been directed to disburse ₹5.5 lakh each to clear memo of fees provided by Attorney General of India and Advocate-on-Record

title: Sparks fly in Kerala Assembly over State’s high retail inflation rate, Opposition UDF stages walkout
content: Minister for Food and Civil Supplies G.R. Anil says prices of none of the commodities vital to common people were up. He attributes the high inflation rate in August, 9.04% against the all-India rate of 2.07%, to the steep rise in the price of certain commodities under the ‘Food and Beverages’ and ‘Miscellaneous’ categories such as oil and fats, gold and silver

title: Outlet or trap? Residents point to faulty drain design for flooding in Balagere
content: Constructed between 2020 and 2021, the rajakaluve in this stretch has no continuity; it has several missing links and a faulty gradient. Instead of carrying rainwater in one direction, the drain pushes water from both sides with no exit

title: Delhi court stays order asking journalists to take down content against Adani Enterprises
content: The judge noted that the defendants should have been given an opportunity to be heard before such sweeping directions were issued.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Plea seeks stay on sale of Arundhati Roy’s book: Kerala HC seeks Centre’s response on cover photo showing her smoking without statutory warning label
content: Referring to the cover photo as an act of ‘intellectual arrogance’, the petitioner, Advocate Rajasimhan, submitted that the book violated Section 5 of the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products (Prohibition of Advertisement and Regulation of Trade and Commerce, Production, Supply and Distribution) Act, 2013

title: NHAI cracks down on subcontracting in highway projects
content: New policy circular redefines ‘similar work’ criteria, imposes penalties for unauthorised subcontracting

title: K.C. Venugopal urges Centre to expedite certification of BSL-3 lab at NIV Alappuzha
content: Once funds are disbursed, laboratory will facilitate testing and confirmation of high-risk pathogens such as Nipah virus, thereby eliminating dependence on NIV Pune, the MP says

title: Bengaluru Traffic Police bring back weekday drunk-driving tests to curb accidents, crime
content: About two years ago, the BTP stopped conducting daily checks, restricting them to weekends following a wave of complaints that personnel deployed at checkpoints were demanding bribes.

title: CPI(M) leader flays defamation campaign against her by alleged right-wing social media handles
content: K.J. Shine says she will petition the Chief Minister, the Kerala Women’s Commission, and the State Police Chief against the attempts to defame her through social media

title: Japanese tissue mending technique being used to preserve archival documents: T.N. Minister Govi. Chezhiaan
content: He said to encourage research and publications on the history of the region, especially Tamil Nadu, the government was providing a stipend of ₹25,000 a month to young researchers

title: No separate caste enumeration exercise planned for Kerala, says Minister
content: Representation of backward communities and other communities eligible for reservation in govt., quasi-govt. institutions in State available through e-CDESK

title: Congress gives notice for no-confidence motion against Mohan Majhi government in Odisha
content: Congress has sought support of Biju Janata Dal in 147-member House as the regional party currently has 50 members

title: Solution to India-U.S. tariff issues likely in eight to 10 weeks: CEA V. Anantha Nageswaran
content: The Chief Economic Adviser said that conversations are going on between India and U.S. governments underneath the surface

title: Two-day clean energy expo will begin in Vizag on September 19
content: Representatives from 100 companies will discuss strategies to attract investments in renewable energy, storage, green hydrogen, and related sectors of Andhra Pradesh

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly to meet until September 30, TDP proposes 18 issues for debate
content: The Assembly will remain closed on September 20, 21, and 28. Proceedings will run daily from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., the BAC decided

title: SSC detects remote hacking attempts in CGLE; warns of strict criminal action
content: The SSC advised all candidates not to indulge in any malpractice, adding that the commission is committed to ensuring fair and transparent examinations

title: ‘Entirely baseless’: Vantara says cleared of water resource misuse, carbon credits allegations after Supreme Court-appointed SIT clean chit
content: The SIT cleared Vantara, run by Reliance Foundation, of all major allegations, including claims that it was acquiring animals to profit from carbon credits, the statement said

title: T.N. government increases pensions for freedom fighters, special pensions for descendants
content: An increase of ₹500 in the ‘special pension’, from ₹10,500 to ₹11,000, has been made effective from August 15

title: Vijay’s Tiruchi campaign: Madras High Court orders framing of guidelines to penalise political parties for damage to public property
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar issues the interim direction while hearing a case filed by actor Vijay’s TVK, alleging onerous conditions being imposed on it for the grant of permission for his campaign

title: CJI breaks silence after 48-hour social media outrage over his Lord Vishnu idol remarks, says he believes in ‘true secularism’
content: His remarks were intended to convey that the court could not possibly intervene as the area was a protected monument; Chief Justice Gavai said the comments had been taken out of context

title: ‘It would be better to avoid such remarks’: VHP chief on CJI’s remarks in Khajuraho case
content: The Chief Justice of India’s oral remark has mocked the faiths of Hinduism, says VHP president Alok Kumar

title: Bevco’s plastic bottle buy-back scheme in Kerala sees 40% return rate
content: Responding to complaints of long queues at outlets, Bevco CMD Harshita Attaluri acknowledges that process of sticking QR-coded labels onto bottles for which a refundable deposit is charged from customers is causing longer queues at billing counters

title: Fire due to short circuit guts house in Kovur
content: Fortunately, no one was killed or injured during the incident at Thippa Tribal Colony in Pothireddipalem village

title: BJP terms Rahul’s charges against ECI baseless, accuses Congress of running “infiltrators first politics” agenda
content: BJP MP Anurag Thakur dared the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi to go to court if his arguments have strength

title: Bengaluru yoga guru Niranjana Murthy arrested for sexually assaulting minor girl student
content: She alleged that, in 2023, she went with the accused to participate in a competition in Thailand where he sexually assaulted her. She subsequently quit participating in competitions and stopped going to the yoga centre, according to the FIR

title: Delay in recruitment of teachers puts Anna University in a tough spot
content: Before the start of the academic year, the university temporarily suspended at least 20 post-graduate programmes where student enrolment dwindled to less than half of the sanctioned strength

title: Bombay High Court issues notice to acquitted and NIA in Malegaon blast victims’ appeal
content: The Bombay High Court has sought replies from the seven acquitted accused, NIA and the Maharashtra government to respond to the petition files by the victims’ family.

title: IRCTC offers Panch Jyotirling Yatra via Mangaluru from November 21
content: Pilgrims can expect to visit Nageshwar, Somnath, Bhimashankar, Triambakeshwar and Girishneshwar along with Ellora Caves

title: Bihar to provide financial assistance of ₹1,000 per month to unemployed graduates, says CM Nitish Kumar ahead of polls
content: Since November 2005, providing government jobs and employment to more and more youth and empowering and enabling them has been our top priority, CM Nitish Kumar posted on X

title: VTU to teach foreign languages to engineering students in Karnataka through online platform
content: In a letter to Higher Education Minister Dr. M.C. Sudhakar and VTU, Mr. Patil suggested introducing Japanese and German languages as elective courses in the VTU curriculum

title: ‘No moral right’ to judge leaders over 75: Sharad Pawar, day after PM Modi’s birthday
content: The NCP (SP) chief, working at the age of 85, said that "people in the BJP now say they have never said that leaders after the age of 75 should take a backseat"

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Mercury force Game 3, Lynx rally to sweep Valkyries
content: last year, all four first-round series ended in sweeps . the top-seeded Minnesota Lynx rallied from a 17-point deficit to beat the Valkyries on the road . last season, the defending champions were beaten by the Phoenix Mercury .

title: Tucker Kraft, Brian Branch lead Team of the Week 2
content: totw 2's limited editions (LTDs) sporting 89 OVR are Green Bay Packers TE Tucker Kraft and Detroit Lions safety Brian Branch . Kraft earned his LTD with six receptions, 124 receiving yards and one touchdown .

title: Best bets: Take the points with Arizona State at Baylor?
content: college football week 4 brings a board full of numbers that look tempting at first glance . some of these matchups hinge on mismatches in the trenches, others on pace and red zone execution . a few are simply about trusting what we already know .

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Crawford takes top spot; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford defeated canelo alvarez by unanimous decision in may 2024 . the victory catapulted him from the no. 3 spot all the way to the top . he is the only men's fighter in the four-belt era (since 2007) to be undisputed champion in three divisions .

title: How Crawford-Álvarez upended the superfight?
content: Carl Washington is the one who runs a boxing gym in downtown Omaha . "Canelo. Then you and your grandkids can retire," he says . a few are professionals but most are amateurs . they dream of becoming boxing world chris lvarez .

title: What MLB aces look like in 2025 compared to past decades
content: no pitcher has more than one nine-inning complete game this season . one hundred pitches is now viewed as the top limit for a pitch count . the list goes on, with pitchers rarely exceeding 110 . in 1985, 20-year-old right-hander Dwight Gooden went 24-4 with 1.53 ERA .

title: What we're watching for all 32 NHL teams as the preseason begins
content: the 2025 NHL draft was decentralized, but there was no shortage of memorable moments and celebrity cameos . a chill enters the air, the leaves start to change color and pumpkin-themed items appear on food and drink menu . how to watch the NHL season on ESPN networks -- including 100 exclusive games .

title: How Seth Rollins pulled off the biggest injury ruse in WWE history
content: CM Punk and seth Rollins clash at Wrestlepalooza live on the ESPN App . rollins paused to add to the drama as he made his exit . he said: "when you hear the music of the guy who's got the Money in the Bank briefcase, your immediate reaction is, ' Here comes the cash-in'
